newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine to put 30 pct tax on T-bills from July 1.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine to put 30 pct tax on T-bills from July 1.

text.p: A 30 percent tax on business profits will be extended from July 1 to earnings from discount Treasury bills purchased at auction, a senior parliamentary deputy said on Friday.

"The new Ukrainian law on business profit tax passed late on Thursday will introduce taxation of T-bills in the primary market at a basic rate of 30 percent from July 1," Vadim Hetman, deputy head of parliament's finance and banking committee, told Reuters.
Earnings on Ukraine's T-bills, which have proved so popular with foreigners they helped support the hryvnia currency, are tax-free at the moment.
Hetman said the decision could lead to a significant drop in funds from the market, 60 percent of which was taken up by non-residents, and to a rise in the cost of credits.
Hetman said the state had been struggling to avoid printing money to cover the budget deficit and T-bills were the only source of cash for the first half.
This year's budget, essential for Ukraine to receive a $2.5-$3.0 billion International Monetary Fund loan, has still to be approved.
